metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12363 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when script uses mutation eventsto move DOM nodes between documents, resulting in the old document thatheld the node being freed but the node still having a pointer referencingit. This results in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerabilityaffects Thunderbird < 60, Thunderbird < 52.9, Firefox ESR < 60.1, FirefoxESR < 52.9, and Firefox < 61.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12363` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
